bug.short_desc: Table scroller uses a lot of CPU in IE10

long_desc.thetext:
The Qx class "qx.ui.table.pane.Scroller" always starts a "scroll timer" by default with a timeout of 100 msec. Based on the comments above property "scrollTimeout" someone here had set the timeout to zero which is supposed to clear the timer which we interpreted as it wouldn't run. It turns out it goes off without stopping in IE10 resulting in an application that uses a lot of CPU.
Also the code executed when the timer goes off (see the _oninterval method) does nothing because it checks for member "this.__updateContentPlanned" which is never set to true due to commented out code in the _postponedUpdateContent method (I'm using 3.0.1)
For now I subscribed to the "appear" event to stop the timer but I feel it can be removed from the Scroller code since it will never execute.
